Sentencas: This modeling study focuses on gasification of carbon by CO2 in a minimally fluidized bed containing a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC).
Titulo: Modeling of CO2 Gasification of Carbon for Integration with Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Kinetic parameters for a five-step reaction mechanism characterizing the Boudouard reaction (C + CO2 -> 2CO) were determined thermogravimetrically at 1 atm from 973 to 1273 K. Experimentally determined kinetic parameters are employed in a transport model that predicts velocities and gas concentration profiles established in the carbon bed as a consequence of convection, diffusion, and heterogeneous reaction.
Titulo: Modeling of CO2 Gasification of Carbon for Integration with Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The model is used to simulate the effect of an imbedded SOFC, in contact with the carbon bed.
Titulo: Modeling of CO2 Gasification of Carbon for Integration with Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Although the model does not assume particular I-V characteristics for the fuel cell, it indicates that current densities in the practical range of 100-1000 mA/cm(2) can be supported.
Titulo: Modeling of CO2 Gasification of Carbon for Integration with Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Results show that temperature strongly affects the current density, whereas CO2 flow I-ate has only a weak effect.
Titulo: Modeling of CO2 Gasification of Carbon for Integration with Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: (C) 2009 American Institute of Chemical Engineers AIChE J, 55: 983-992, 2009
Titulo: Modeling of CO2 Gasification of Carbon for Integration with Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
